items.title: Spot Prices Wrap: As Forecasts Tease More Cold Ahead, Natural Gas Cash Backs off Record Highs
items.summary: After surging over the past several sessions as bone-chilling cold canvassed much of the country, U.S. natural gas spot prices gave back a chunk of the gains Tuesday but remained elevated versus pre-Winter Storm Fern levels.

items.title: Futures Settle: Natural Gas Rally Slows, Though Cold Snap Far From Over
items.summary: Despite stout heating demand and with substantial volumes of production still offline, the most heavily traded natural gas futures contract fell modestly on Tuesday as traders took profits amid the wreckage of Winter Storm Fern.

items.title: U.S. LNG Export Fluctuations, Severe Winter Weather Propping up Global Natural Gas Prices
items.summary: European natural gas traders are still eyeing further cold weather and U.S. LNG supply, adding a bullish upside to an otherwise stable global natural gas market.

items.title: MidDay Snapshot: Freeze-Offs, Deliverability Issues Keep Spot Gas Prices Elevated Despite Declines
items.summary: Spot gas prices retreated for Wednesday delivery at most major hubs, yet prices remained elevated as bitter cold gripping the eastern half of the country fueled demand and strained deliverability.

items.title: Golden Triangle Storage Offline as Piercing Cold Tests Nation’s Natural Gas Pipeline Grid
items.summary: At least a dozen forces majeures have been declared across the country over the past week, along with operational flow orders and severe weather alerts that have impacted flows on natural gas pipelines, compressor stations and at storage facilities.

items.title: MidDay Futures: Traders Pull February Natural Gas Lower as Expiration Looms
items.summary: Traders pulled February Nymex natural gas prices lower Tuesday afternoon, with just one day left before the prompt month contract expires at the close of trading Wednesday.

items.title: Mexico’s Natural Gas System Weathers Polar Vortex, but Strategic Fragility Remains
items.summary: Mexico’s natural gas and electricity grid has so far withstood the pressure of the punishing cold blast north of the border, but market participants once again underscored that winter storms magnify a basic fragility.

items.title: Midmorning Markets: Canadian Natural Gas Cash Prices Mixed Amid Robust U.S. Demand
items.summary: Canadian natural gas spot prices at key hubs jumped alongside those in the Lower 48 to start the trading week, supported by a surge in heating demand on both sides of the U.S. border. Some western hubs, however, retreated.

items.title: Freeze-Offs Near Record, Setting Stage for Natural Gas ‘Deliverability’ Issues and Upside Volatility
items.summary: U.S. natural gas production freeze-offs hit a single-day high of 17 Bcf on Sunday (Jan. 25), according to Wood Mackenzie, with the worst to come in the Appalachian Basin as temperatures are forecast to fall well below zero in the Northeast this week.

items.title: Natural Gas ‘Supersized Rally to the Moon’ Risks ‘Stampede’ to Exit if Forecasts Shift
items.summary: After getting caught flat-footed by January’s late-winter cold snap, natural gas traders are giving more respect to weather forecasts, with the widening widow maker spread signaling more anxiety about tighter balances.

items.title: Eastern Mediterranean Gas Balance Shifts as Israel Ramps Up Production
items.summary: Israel is set to achieve record natural gas production in 2026, with expansion projects in the Leviathan and Tamar fields expected to push total output above 3 billion cubic feet per day (cfd) for the first time ever. According to the experts, the Ch

items.title: Oil Supertanker Markets Stay Red-Hot as Sanctions and Rerouting Bite
items.summary: Oil tanker rates are soaring this year, picking up where they left off 2025—multi-year highs amid growing supply, longer routes, and disruptions due to sanctions and altered shipping lanes.    At the end of 2025, the global supertanker market tighten

items.title: Global Oil Discoveries Are Badly Lagging Consumption
items.summary: The world’s oil production is running flat out, with consumption far outstripping new discoveries. According to Norwegian energy consultancy Rystad Energy, annual conventional discovered volumes averaged more than 20 billion barrels of oil equivalent

items.title: Iraq’s Most Strategic Gas Field Just Sent a Signal Washington Has Been Waiting F
items.summary: The start of full drilling operations just over a week ago at Iraq’s Akkas gas field -- led by U.S. oilfield services giant Schlumberger along with the state?owned Midland Oil -- could signal far more than an overdue upstream milestone. Given the eno

items.title: Sanctions Squeeze Iran’s Oil Revenues Despite Higher Output
items.summary: Iran’s oil industry has been under sanctions since Donald Trump’s first term. Since then, Iran has seen its pool of buyers shrink to leave only China—but China has been a big enough buyer to not only keep Iran’s oil industry afloat, but help it grow,
